data.title: Travelling
data.statement:
You are in a multi transportational race, you will be given a distance to go and different modes of transportation. You must see if you will make it to the finish line, make it exactly to the finish line or if you don't make it to the finish line.
{{17987547.48}} km/min = the speed of light <<shown as a string {{LIGHT}}>>
{{20.58}} km/min = the speed of sound <<shown as a string {{SOUND}}>>
{{3.3}} km/min = the speed of your motorcycle <<shown as a string {{MOTO}}>>
{{0.083}} km/min = your swimming pace <<shown as a string {{SWIM}}>>
{{0.06}} km/min = your walking pace <<shown as a string {{WALK}}>>

data.stubGenerator:
read distance:int

write Did I make it?
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>> The distance as an integer to be traveled in kilometers [[Distance]]
<<Line 2>> The number of different transportation modes [[n]]
<<Next [[n]] lines>>  the current form of [[Transportation]]  and [[Time]] an integer in minutes travelling seperated by a space
data.outputDescription:
{{Overshot by }}[[overshot]] if you go past the finish line, where [[overshot]] refers to the distance that you overshot the end goal, rounded to one decimal place
{{Did not make the trip}} if you did not make it to the end point.
{{Finished!!}} if you made it exactly to the finish point

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are in a multi transportational race, you will be given a distance to go and different modes of transportation. You must see if you will make it to the finish line, make it exactly to the finish line or if you don't make it to the finish line.
17987547.48 km/min = the speed of light shown as a string LIGHT
20.58 km/min = the speed of sound shown as a string SOUND
3.3 km/min = the speed of your motorcycle shown as a string MOTO
0.083 km/min = your swimming pace shown as a string SWIM
0.06 km/min = your walking pace shown as a string WALK
Input
Line 1 The distance as an integer to be traveled in kilometers Distance
Line 2 The number of different transportation modes n
Next n lines the current form of Transportation and Time an integer in minutes travelling seperated by a space
Output
Overshot by overshot if you go past the finish line, where overshot refers to the distance that you overshot the end goal, rounded to one decimal place
Did not make the trip if you did not make it to the end point.
Finished!! if you made it exactly to the finish point
Constraints
0<Distance
0<n<10
0<Time≤100
Example
Input
10
1
SOUND 10
Output
Overshot by 195.8
